alert.note: Alert for Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 04 at 5:07PM CDT until August 04 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Pike County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 506 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Troy Municipal Airport, or 8 miles north of Troy, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Goshen, Banks, Antioch, Troy University, Tennille, Hamilton Crossroads, Monticello, Springhill, Tarentum, Brundidge Municipal Airport, Mossy Grove and Henderson. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
